results.firPara: After waiting 58 years to return to a major tournament, Wales made up for lost time with a thrilling victory that gets their Euro 2016 campaign off to the best possible start. It was a dramatic match that swung one way and then the other before Hal Robson-Kanu, who is currently out of contract with Reading, upstaged Gareth Bale to emerge as an unlikely hero.
results.secPara: Introduced as a second-half substitute, and at a time when the game was in danger of slipping away from Wales after Ondrej Duda had come off the bench to equalise for Slovakia with his first touch, Robson-Kanu steered home a left-footed shot to spark wild celebrations on the pitch and in the stands. It was only his third international goal and, with only nine minutes remaining, could not have been timed better.
results.webTitle: Hal Robson-Kanu strikes to give Wales opening victory over Slovakia

results.firPara: Heres Stuart Jamess match report from Bordeaux. Enjoy, Wales fans.
results.secPara: After 58 years, Wales can celebrate not merely participation in a major tournament - but a victory! They made an accomplished start but were on the ropes for a while in the second half, but the introductions of Robson-Kanu and Ledley turned things back in their favour before Robson-Kanu secured an historic win. Its the perfect start for Wales, and whos to say how it will end. Therell be an epoch-defining party in Bordeaux tonight, for one thing.
results.webTitle: Wales 2-1 Slovakia: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: • We need to embrace the situation – expectations will not be a burden on us
results.secPara: • We need to embrace the situation – expectations will not be a burden on us
results.webTitle: Northern Ireland have nothing to fear before Euro debut, says Michael O’Neill

results.firPara: Albania waited 70 years to play in a major tournament and then lost their first match in one inside the opening five minutes.
results.secPara: The culprit was Etrit Berisha, the Albania goalkeeper who will not wish to see again how he flew at a Xherdan Shaqiri corner and missed it to allow Fabian Schär to head into an empty net for what proved to be the winner.
results.webTitle: Switzerland and Fabian Schär quick to spoil Albania’s bit of history

results.firPara: Miralem Pjanic has enacted a clause in his contract to force through a €38m (£30m) move to Juventus, according to Romas general manager, Mauro Baldissoni.
results.secPara: The talented 26-year-old had been linked with a move to the Premier League but Juventus confirmed that he is to undergo a medical in Turin in due course.
results.webTitle: Juventus set to sign Roma’s Miralem Pjanic for £30m after clause triggered

results.firPara: Fabian Schars early header earned Switzerland an opening weekend win against 10-man Albania, who had their captain, Lorik Cana, sent off late in the first half
results.secPara: Fabian Schars early header earned Switzerland an opening weekend win against 10-man Albania, who had their captain, Lorik Cana, sent off late in the first half
results.webTitle: Albania 0-1 Switzerland: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: Vicente del Bosque has insisted the Spain squad will offer support and affection to David de Gea, after the goalkeeper was named in a sexual assault case.
results.secPara: The 25-year-old has denied any involvement in the case after being named by a protected witness as the person who allegedly arranged and paid for an encounter between two Spain Under-21 players and two women in a Madrid hotel in 2012. According to a report published by the website ElDiario.es on Friday, one of the under-21 players is named as the Athletic Bilbao forward Iker Muniain while the other has not been identified. In a short statement Muniains agent, Jesús Medina, denied any knowledge of the alleged case.
results.webTitle: Vicente del Bosque: we have never considered sending David de Gea home

results.firPara: Richard Keogh will never forget the feeling of rejection, the emptiness it caused and the fear a long-held dream stood to be crushed. For the Derby County and Republic of Ireland central defender, the first time was the worst, when Ipswich Town – his club since the age of eight – chose not to offer him a scholarship at 16. But it was not much easier when Stoke City released him at 18.
results.secPara: Keoghs story is one of grit, his style synonymous with rugged durability. And when the Republics anthem plays at Stade de France on Monday, before the Euro 2016 Group E opener with Sweden, he might spare a moment to reflect on a remarkable personal journey. Then again, the Essex-born 29-year-old is not the sentimental type.
results.webTitle: Richard Keogh knows how to make Ireland smile after being steeled by hurt

results.firPara: Frances Premier League contingent made a solid enough start to Euro 2016, with Olivier Giroud, NGolo Kanté and Hugo Lloris making notable contributions to the win over Romania and Dimitri Payet emerging as the opening-night hero, though whether the hosts fully justified their billing as pre-tournament favourites was a lot less clear.
results.secPara: Antoine Griezmann and Paul Pogba, two of the players expected to be pivotal to French hopes, were substituted before Payets winner, when the overall feeling was that Didier Deschampss men were enduring a frustrating evening. Neither was particularly awful, though Griezmann was ineffective when he could have been incisive and Pogba looked good in short bursts without exerting the midfield control that had been expected.
results.webTitle: Dimitri Payet’s move from periphery to centre of France’s success | Paul Wilson
